Authors:
Mabel Angela Lizarazu, M. Amalia Scataglini, Susana E.
Freire
Title:
Testing the monophyly of Heterosperma (Asteraceae,
Coreopsideae)
Keywords:
Coreopsis cyclocarpa, Electranthera, Henricksonia, ITS,
trnL-trnF
Abstract:
The genus Heterosperma (Asteraceae, Coreopsideae)
currently comprises ten species distributed from Mexico to South
America. Molecular phylogenies of the tribe Coreopsideae (including only
two species of Heterosperma) pointed out that the genus would be not
monophyletic. We performed a molecular phylogenetic analysis including
seven species of Heterosperma and related taxa, using plastid and
nuclear sequences. The results indicated that Heterosperma is
monophyletic if Coreopsis cyclocarpa is included in the genus, so the
new combination Heterosperma cyclocarpum is proposed. Morphological
analysis of the floral trichomes, pappus and cypselae, and a comparative
table of these morphological features are presented. a A key to related
genera, and distribution maps are also provided.
